benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: DELETE /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host out of rotation

covered: DELETE - Valid Deletion: Success path returns 204 with host state changed and verified (TC01, TC12).
DELETE - Non-Existent Resource/Invalid State: Attempts when host already out of rotation or when no hosts are available return 409 (TC04, TC14).
DELETE - Concurrency: Concurrent requests handled; first succeeds, subsequent requests receive appropriate status (TC11).
Error handling: 400 (invalid/malicious body), 500 (system error), 503 (service down) are exercised (TC09, TC06, TC05).
Authorization: 401 for missing and invalid credentials covered (TC02, TC03).
Method robustness: 405 for wrong HTTP method covered (TC07).
Input tolerance: Extra query parameters do not break success (TC08).
Security hardening: Header injection scenario covered (TC13).
Performance: Latency under normal and concurrent load validated (TC10, TC11).
gaps: Headers/Content negotiation: Story states Produces: application/json, but tests do not assert Content-Type on 204 or on error responses; also no explicit assertion that 204 has an empty body.
Authorization roles: No scenario for authenticated but unauthorized (non-admin) user receiving 403 Forbidden.
Idempotency semantics: Repeated DELETE behavior is ambiguous; TC04 expects 409 and TC11 allows 409 or 204. Define and test a deterministic idempotency policy.
Error schema: No validation of a standard JSON error structure/fields for 4xx/5xx responses.
Rate limiting: No scenario verifying behavior under excessive request rates (e.g., 429).
Resilience headers: No checks for Retry-After on 503 or presence of correlation/request-id headers in errors.
Unsupported media type: No test for incorrect Content-Type header on DELETE (e.g., expect 415 or defined behavior).
Routing: No scenario for wrong path returning 404 Not Found.
recommendations: Add assertions for response headers: verify Content-Type application/json on error responses; decide and document whether 204 should omit Content-Type or return a consistent header, and assert empty body.
Add a 403 Forbidden scenario for an authenticated user lacking admin privileges.
Define and test idempotency: add a scenario that sends DELETE twice and asserts the exact second response (204 or 409) per spec; make TC11 deterministic.
Validate a standard JSON error schema (fields like code, message, requestId/timestamp) across 4xx/5xx cases.
Introduce rate limiting tests to validate 429 behavior (if supported) and any Retry-After semantics.
Add tests for incorrect or conflicting Content-Type headers on DELETE to verify 415 Unsupported Media Type or documented behavior.
Add a negative routing test calling an invalid URL to assert 404 Not Found.
Expand security tests to include query-parameter injection and extremely long header values, expecting robust 400 handling.
